movie_night.title: How to Succeed In Business Without Really Trying
And anything with a 60s modern feel or a treachery in business vibe

score.title: Madison Avenue, The Only Place To Be
paragraphs: ...if you're in the advertising game. Looking down on the bustle and movement from the windows of 17th floor that your agency leases, a drink in your hand and the pressure to come up with the next big thing, you are living the life. The life, however, consists of stress, excessive drinking, illicit affairs, and plenty of secrets interwoven into the glam and glitz that money brings. Your life may look great from the outside, and you are the envy of the town, but you go to extremes to hold it all together. In your world, when things break, they break in the most spectacular ways. Maybe you chose this world and were ready for the cut‐throat politics and struggles you would face on the rise to the top, or maybe you are an innocent bystander drawn in through your work, your spouse, or your innocent desire to be somebody. You aren't likely to get out without getting a little dirty.

Get your suit, press your dress, grab the cigarettes and the booze, and get ready to spin things in your favor as you try to work your way to the top or get out before the stress makes your exit permanent.

In writing this playset, we tried to strike a fine balance between specific and vague elements that would allow you to personalize things in your own way. Many of the elements under Locations and Objects are left open to interpretation so that you can weave the stories that inspire you. Please feel free to change genders, details, and the structures of any elements if the inspiration strikes you. A good element to interweave into the setup is coming up with the name of your advertising agency. You could make it a conglomeration of the names of the characters playing the partners or just work in hilarious inside jokes.

Another fun element we included under objects were advertisements. These were left blank so that you could come up with and pitch the details of the advertisement to the group. Getting wrapped up in the pitch during the game is heavily encouraged and can be very entertaining, if not all together serious. A good pitch could bring people to tears and be a very important, well remembered part of the game.

relationships.title: Within The Company
elements: Experienced mentor and new protégée
Rising star in the company and the executive resting on his laurels
The person who does the hard work and the person who takes the credit
Rival account men vying for respect and prestige
The old guard executive who cares about the company's legacy and the young turk partner who only cares about the money and perks
The silent partner who owns stock and the executive whose plans she gets in the way of

relationships.title: Externally Illicit
elements: The client who expects to get his way and the person in the company he fancies
The young starlet looking to break in and the agency man who takes advantage of it
The account man selling inside secrets and the rival who is buying them
The client who parties too much and the account man who has to clean up after him
The client with shady business and the person in creative who spins it into legitimacy
The client lured into an affair and the company man who lures him

relationships.title: Internally Illicit
elements: The secretary and the person she is having the affair with
The boss's wife and her lover in the company
The people scheming together to rise in the ranks at any cost
The one night stand at the company party
The person stealing money from the company and the one who suspects it
The person with a secret and the one who knows their secret

relationships.title: business rivalries
elements: The friendship with a rival at another agency
The one who always wins the award and the one jealous of it
The bitter rivalry with a competitor
The one who was fired and the person they feel is responsible for it
The employee who moved on and the one who was left behind
The client everyone is after and the person with the inside track to them

relationships.title: Family And Romance
elements: The spurned wife and the unavailable husband
The co‐worker who got in because of nepotism
The couple who separated
The ones who want to be together, but can't
The client who is family with the company man
The one who followed you here and regrets it

relationships.title: Shadows of the Past
elements: The previous significant other
The one whose sudden reappearance causes your life to unravel
The shady person who helped the fledgling company and now wants to reap the rewards
The one who knows what you did during the war
The one who helped you steal the money
The one who has always, secretly looked out for you

locations.title: on the 17th Floor
elements: Your office, where everyone gathers to meet... and drink
The lavish office of the chief partner
The conference room where everything happens, officially
In the shared office that no one wants
In the elevator, on the way up or down
In the creative pool, pitching ideas and making jokes

locations.title: Out On The Town
elements: ...at the fancy restaurant with the astronomical prices
...slumming it with the hippies in the village
...at the brothel where all the clients want to go
...with front row seats at the Broadway show
...in the bar that never closes
...travelling in the back of the taxi cab

locations.title: The Rendezvous Point
elements: The hotel room that you rent in the middle of the afternoon
The apartment in the city that only one other knows about
The bar/hotel/alley where you meet the person blackmailing you
The train car that you commute on every day
The office ‐ after hours when everyone else is gone
The private club with many private areas to speak in

locations.title: The Place You Lay Your Head
elements: The house in the suburbs where your family lives
The apartment that somebody else pays for
The fancy apartment that you want to move into
The run‐down boarding room that you are ashamed of
The couch in your office
The penthouse you bought because it's what others expect of you

locations.title: The Place You'd Rather Forget
elements: The house you grew up in but were ashamed of
The fancy house that never felt like home
The site of the crime that you never got caught for
The bloody battlefield that shows up in your flashbacks
The room you were in the only time you felt powerless
The place you buried the body

locations.title: the Place You Shouldn't Be
elements: On the doorstep of their home
The place you retreat to when you should be working
The ledge you've contemplated jumping off of every single day
At the party, one too many drinks in, knowing you should stop talking but the words keep flowing
The 'perfect' home, where every detail is a careful lie
The business that is a front for something more sinister

needs.title: To Advance
elements: ...in your profession
...in social status and finally be equal
...in a personal relationship that has stalled
...in the political arena or the public limelight
...past your rival, by any means necessary
...without doing the actual work

needs.title: To Get Away
elements: ...from the hectic pace of the city
...from the company that doesn't appreciate you
...from the toxic relationship that holds you back
...from the sedate life that bores you incredibly
...from the debts you hold that constantly chase you
...from temptation you want to give in to

needs.title: To Be
elements: ...a better father/husband/wife/mother
...the one that everyone respects
...safe, for once in your life
...unburdened from the weights on your shoulders
...the one they are willing to give everything up for
...someone else, even if that person is worse than who you are now

needs.title: To Get Respect
elements: ...from the one you are with
...from the one you want to be with
...your boss
...your peers
...your clients
...because you've never had it before

needs.title: To Get Revenge
elements: ...on the ones who passed you over
...on the ones who disrespected you
...on the one who holds a secret over your head
...on the one who ruined what you had before
...for the one that society holds back
...even though you don't deserve it

needs.title: To Move On
elements: ...from the past
...to a better relationship
...to something more exciting
...to something more stable
...to a better company
...to a better account than the one you are stuck on

objects.title: That Are Found In The Office
elements: The dicta‐phone that caught something it shouldn't have
The cartons of cigarettes, free for the taking
The stacks of magazines with inspiring ads in them
The personal bar with the best booze
The freebies from the clients
A loaded revolver in someone else's drawer

objects.title: That Remind You Of The Past
elements: A photograph of a man and a kid fishing
The kitchen knife with deep stains
The old wedding ring with the unreadable inscription
The old cabinet that belonged to your father
The old shoebox with the letters in it
The only beautiful piece of jewelry that you own

objects.title: That Are Dangerous
elements: The gift from your secret lover
The drug that helps you stay stable
The gun that has your fingerprints on it
The weed‐whacker from the client
The suitcase full of money
A ledger full of the real numbers and names

objects.title: Transportation
elements: The taxi cab with the driver who knows too much
The train that takes you out of town
The car you drive at night when you need to think
The family car with the dent that never seems to get removed
The airplane that might be able to get you far enough away
The yacht that can get to international waters quickly

objects.title: The Advertisements
elements: The ad for __________ that is exactly like another ad
The ad for __________ that weighs on your conscience
The ad for __________ with a famous star that lead to an affair
The ad for __________ that ruined a friendship
The ad for __________ that you wish you came up with
The ad for __________ that you came up with and everyone else is jealous of

objects.title: That Are Signs OF The Times
elements: The tickets that everybody wants
The newspaper with the headline about the assassination
The controversial book that everyone is talking about
The movie that changed everything
The office equipment that changed the way business is done
The drug that changed the way you think about your life
